Thank you for your Pull Request! 🙏

Before you submit, please check that:

candidates.title: rpc rebase: Try-runtime Revamp and Facelift

labels.name: A0-please_review
labels.description: Pull request needs code review.

labels.name: B0-silent
labels.description: Changes should not be mentioned in any release notes

labels.name: C1-low
labels.description: PR touches the given topic and has a low impact on builders.

labels.name: D5-nicetohaveaudit ⚠️
labels.description: PR contains trivial changes to logic that should be properly reviewed.

candidates.body:
This PR merges the `origin/master` into https://github.com/paritytech/substrate/pull/12537.

The main focus of this PR is to handle the new batch request API exposed by the jsonrpsee
in `utils/frame/remote-externalities/src/lib.rs`.

Jsonrpsee changed the API of batch requests and failures are reported via `Err(ErrorObject<'static>)`.

To reflect this change, a new inter-thread messaging is added `BatchFailed`.
Whenever the `BatchFailed` message is encountered, we stop the main waiting loop
and ensure that threads are joined before returning.

candidates.title: Ensure that we inform all tasks to stop before starting the 60 seconds shutdown

labels.name: A0-please_review
labels.description: Pull request needs code review.

labels.name: B0-silent
labels.description: Changes should not be mentioned in any release notes

labels.name: C1-low
labels.description: PR touches the given topic and has a low impact on builders.

labels.name: D3-trivial 🧸
labels.description: PR contains trivial changes in a runtime directory that do not require an audit

candidates.body:
The change of waiting in maximum 60 seconds for the node to shutdown actually introduced a bug. We were actually waiting always 60 seconds as we didn't informed our tasks to shutdown. The solution to this problem is to drop the task manager as this will then inform all tasks to end. It also adds tests to ensure that the behaviors work as expected. (This should already have been done in the first pr! :()

Closes: https://github.com/paritytech/substrate/issues/12892

candidates.title: Remove sandboxing host function interface

labels.name: A0-please_review
labels.description: Pull request needs code review.

labels.name: C1-low
labels.description: PR touches the given topic and has a low impact on builders.

labels.name: D3-trivial 🧸
labels.description: PR contains trivial changes in a runtime directory that do not require an audit

candidates.body:
In #12501 we removed the dependence of pallet-contracts on the sandboxing interface. This was its only user and it was never used in production (the interface was never available on validators). pallet-contracts now uses in-runtime wasmi exclusively. In the future when we want to speed up execution we will do that with another interface  and probably a [more suitable bytecode for singlepass compilation](https://forum.polkadot.network/t/ebpf-contracts-hackathon/1084).

This PR also removes the sandboxing functionality and wasmer dependency of `sc-executor`.  It is a prerequisite for a larger refactoring of that crate that should make it much simpler. Sandboxing and execution of runtime should not be conflated in this way.

This removes a host function that was never available on validators and is not used by any project I know of. I add the newhostfunction label just in case, though.

candidates.title: contracts: Replace cargo feature `unstable-interface` with config

labels.name: A0-please_review
labels.description: Pull request needs code review.

labels.name: C1-low
labels.description: PR touches the given topic and has a low impact on builders.

labels.name: D3-trivial 🧸
labels.description: PR contains trivial changes in a runtime directory that do not require an audit

candidates.body:
Hiding a behavior changing config behind a cargo feature wasn't a good idea. We all know how easy this feature can be flipped on due to unification. Also, feature are just flat out annoying and we want to avoid them when possible.

This is why we replace the `unstable-interface` feature with a config knob in this PR. Gives the runtime much more confidence that this feature is actually off. The only grumble that remains is that we need to enable it to perform runtime benchmarks. But at least we don't introduce another config knob with room for error. This also makes sure that the tests for unstable interfaces are always run and stabilization is merely removing one attribute.

polkadot companion: https://github.com/paritytech/cumulus/pull/1916

candidates.title: contracts: Don't put unstable functions in special module

labels.name: A0-please_review
labels.description: Pull request needs code review.

labels.name: B0-silent
labels.description: Changes should not be mentioned in any release notes

labels.name: C1-low
labels.description: PR touches the given topic and has a low impact on builders.

labels.name: D3-trivial 🧸
labels.description: PR contains trivial changes in a runtime directory that do not require an audit

candidates.body:
When we introduced the [unstable interfaces](https://github.com/paritytech/substrate/tree/master/frame/contracts#unstable-interfaces) feature we decided to put those features into a special module called `__unstable__`. This turned out to be a mistake: Whenever we eventually device to stabilize a function we generate a breaking change where a newer `pallet-contracts`version gets incompatible with an older ink!.

This is a big no go for stable functions but is allowed for unstable functions. That said, changing the module on stabilization is just a unnecessary form of breakage. Most of the time functions are stabilized as is.

This PR changes the behavior to to make version and instability orthogonal. The way we want to use this it to put functions into the module in which they are eventually stabilized (if they are).

candidates.title: Implement crate publishing on CI

labels.name: A2-insubstantial
labels.description: Pull request requires no code review (e.g., a sub-repository hash update).

labels.name: B0-silent
labels.description: Changes should not be mentioned in any release notes

labels.name: C1-low
labels.description: PR touches the given topic and has a low impact on builders.

labels.name: D3-trivial 🧸
labels.description: PR contains trivial changes in a runtime directory that do not require an audit

candidates.body:
related to https://github.com/paritytech/release-engineering/issues/129 and https://github.com/paritytech/release-engineering/issues/122

See https://gitlab.parity.io/parity/mirrors/substrate/-/jobs/2107373 for an example.

Note that, although the publishing job is set up for `master`, publishing to crates.io won't be enabled quite yet because some parts of the publishing script are disabled for now (https://github.com/paritytech/releng-scripts/pull/20). The idea is to try the script out for some time while only publishing to the local instance, and after we see that it works fine, the parts of the script which publishes to crates.io will be re-enabled gradually. We also need to resolve https://github.com/paritytech/release-engineering/issues/132 before that.

Some notes for reviewers

- The publishing automation strips away `[dev-dependencies]` before publishing crates, thus some dependencies have been copied from `[dev-dependencies]` to `[dependencies]` as **optional** entries so that `cargo` can find them while verifying the packages' features before publishing.
    Note also that their `[dependencies]` entries don't include a `version` field in their import declaration because it's not relevant for them.
- The CI job's time to completion should be improved substantially after `rusty-cachier` kicks in. `rusty-cachier` 's cache will only be created after the job runs on `master`.

close #12678
close https://github.com/paritytech/release-engineering/issues/122
close https://github.com/paritytech/release-engineering/issues/129

candidates.title: Move import queue out of `sc-network`

labels.name: A0-please_review
labels.description: Pull request needs code review.

labels.name: B0-silent
labels.description: Changes should not be mentioned in any release notes

labels.name: C1-low
labels.description: PR touches the given topic and has a low impact on builders.

candidates.body:
Add supplementary asynchronous API for the import queue which means it can be run as an independent task and communicated with through the `ImportQueueService`.

This commit removes removes block and justification imports from `sc-network` and provides `ChainSync` with a handle to import queue so it can import blocks and justifications. Polling of the import queue is moved complete out of `sc-network` and `sc_consensus::Link` is implemented for `ChainSyncInterfaceHandled` so the import queue can still influence the syncing process.

Related to https://github.com/paritytech/substrate/issues/11295

cumulus companion: https://github.com/paritytech/cumulus/pull/1930

candidates.body:
Fixes https://github.com/paritytech/substrate/issues/12495

Followup of https://github.com/paritytech/substrate/pull/12486

This PR removes the `wasmtime` feature flag. Now `wasmtime` will be always unconditionally compiled in.

Any downstream project that depends on `substrate` and which used to specify the `wasmtime` feature flag in its dependencies now needs to remove it.
